::CyberShark/Zergling::

    CyberShark was hit by some blasts and turned t=
o look at who was shooting.
    "Great," CyberShark said as he lifted Zergl=
ing in front of him. "Just great."
    He threw Zergling who was still a li=
ttle groggy. CyberShark then turned toward the sea, running at full steam. =
He cloaked, he didn't care anymore, guns were shooting at him, but after he=
 cloaked the guns couldn't find him. He jumped into the sea and started to =
swim deeped, transforming to Beast Mode as he did.
    He turned on his pro=
pellor (A tail that splits into four blades) and took off under the water, =
toward somewhere that he might be safe.
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  F=
rom: Yanshosh@... 
  To: nbwrpg@egroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, November 1=
2, 2000 4:11 PM
  Subject: Re: All my Characters


  The Alliance base is i=
n perfect conditions, Dachande.

  To JP: The whole idea behind the mobile =
base rule is that you can't 
  fly a base to a battle, attack with it, and =
retreat, like what was 
  happening before the rule was passed. Your sub is=
 completely going 
  against that. And if you look closely, the IF's main a=
dvantage is 
  that its on an island, not its defences (which are about as =
good as 
  the CF's anyways).

  Mobile base means that bases can't move an=
d be bases at the same 
  times. THe Alliance base wasn't functional when i=
t was moved, it 
  wasn't even together. A moving powerful sub is a complet=
ely different 
  matter.

  ::Zardus::

  Zardus growls, snapping his head =
toward Cybershark as he grabbed 
  Zergling. Looking at his wrist comp to s=
ee the Iron Fist's report on 
  what was happening, he looks back at Cybers=
hark.

  "Kill him," he says, firing his plasma launcher at Cybershark. The=
 
  island defences as well as the Iron Fist's own defences target 
  Cyber=
shark, a horde of laser shots and a lot of missiles streaming 
  toward the=
 bot.

  The shuttles carrying the pieces of the Alliance base lift further=
 
  up, careful to avoid weapon fire.

  Zardus glances down at his wrist c=
omp, looking through other scanner 
  report. The Predacons were back at th=
eir base, and at a spot near the 
  sea...

  He frowns. He'd have to inves=
tigate that later.




  --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "dachande" <Dachande85@=
m...> wrote:
  > ::CyberShark/Zergling::
  > 
  >     They met outside of w=
hat used to be the Alliance base. (If it 
  was destroyed then they weren't=
 in it, I shouldn't be punished for my 
  father not getting e-mail back un=
til last night.) CyberShark looked 
  at Zergling, and saw the mindlessness=
 there. He smiled.
  >     He walked over to Zergling and grabbed him. Zerg=
ling fought 
  back, but to no use. CyberShark opened his head panel and st=
arted to 
  reprogramm him.
  >     A couple of hours later Zergling was re=
programmed. He now 
  served CyberShark unquestiongly, but maintained a fac=
e of loyality to 
  Zardus.


        eGroups Sponsor
